thread.title: 'Bright': First Look at Will Smith Supernatural Cop Movie Arrives During Oscars | Hollywood Reporter
thread.title_full: 'Bright': First Look at Will Smith Supernatural Cop Movie Arrives During Oscars | Hollywood Reporter

title: 'Bright': First Look at Will Smith Supernatural Cop Movie Arrives During Oscars | Hollywood Reporter
text:
7:56pm PT by Aaron Couch 'Bright': First Look at Will Smith Supernatural Cop Movie Arrives During Oscars Twitter/@Netflix The actor reunites with 'Suicide Squad' director David Ayer for the Netflix film. 
Oscars Sunday made room for the supernatural. 
The first ad for Will Smith's Netflix movie Bright dropped during the Oscars telecast on ABC. 
The supernatural cop film is directed by Smith's Suicide Squad helmer David Ayer, and also stars Joel Edgerton. 
Bright is set in a world where magical creatures live side by side with humans. A human cop (Smith) works in the police's division for handling crimes involving magic, and is forced to work with an Orc (Edgerton) to find a powerful wand that bad guys are willing to kill for. Chronicle screenwriter Max Landis penned the script. 
The film is set for a December release on Netflix. Fantasy has become reality. Will Smith and Joel Edgerton star in Bright, only on @netflix . pic.twitter.com/FJueEhMFCO â€” Bright Film (@BrightNetflix) February 27, 2017 Aaron Couch
